descriptions: Teams net points while player is on the court.
Teams net points while player is on the court.

article.description: With Jamal Mashburn out, the Charlotte Hornets have been leaning heavily on guards David Wesley and Baron Davis, who did not fail them in a 106-89 victory over the Golden State Warriors.
article.headline: Wesley leads Hornets with season-best 25 points
article.linkText: Hornets' road show hits another high point vs. Warriors
article.story:
OAKLAND, Calif. (AP) -- David Wesley hopes Charlotte's recent success on the road can translate into success at home.
Wesley

Wesley scored a season-high 25 points as the Hornets won their second road game in as many nights -- and sixth of their last eight -- with a 106-89 victory over the Golden State Warriors on Friday night. "I wish we could bottle it up and take it home," said Wesley, who made a season-high 10 field goals in 17 attempts. "For some reason, we just have that groove when we're away from home." Charlotte is 7-5 on the road this season, 2-5 at home. The Hornets haven't had a winning record on the road since going 24-17 in 1996-97. Baron Davis added 20 points and 14 assists and Elden Campbell added 21 points for the Hornets, who continue their longest road trip of the season -- this was stop No. 4 of six games in 11 days -- Sunday against the Los Angeles Clippers. "We're a little more focused on the road and we have a lot more energy," said Davis. "It feels like everybody is hitting their rhythm and figuring out what they can do to help us win." It may also be that the Hornets don't have to deal with constant talk of ownership selling or moving the team, and poor attendance (only New Jersey has drawn fewer fans). Troy Murphy led the Warriors with 17 points and 13 rebounds. Antawn Jamison had 13 points and Danny Fortson 12 as Golden State lost for the fifth time in six games. "David came out hitting perimeter shots which took us out of our zone," said Murphy, who recorded his third double-double. The Warriors have lost five in a row to Charlotte, including the last three in Oakland. Davis, who scored 22 points with 12 assists in Charlotte's 95-89 victory over Portland on Thursday night, has 86 assists in his last eight games. "I'm just trying to be consistent and stay aggressive," said Davis. The Warriors pulled to 72-66 in the final minute of the third quarter when Murphy beat the shot clock with a layup. That would be as close as Golden State got. Charlotte responded with a 13-4 run to go up 85-70 with just under nine minutes to play. Campbell and Davis combined for nine of those points. "We came with energy and poise and in the fourth quarter we maintained that level," said Davis. "We're believing in ourselves and it's starting to work out." The Hornets eventually led by as many as 20 points in the final five minutes. The Hornets opened a 15-point lead with 1:28 left in the first quarter after Lee Nailon hit a jumper that highlighted an 18-4 run. Wesley scored 14 of his points in the first quarter. "Before I'd even get across halfcourt he was drilling jumper after jumper in the same spot," Jamison said of Wesley. "He definitely was in a rhythm. You can't leave a shooter like open like we did." Charlotte maintained its double-digit lead through the second quarter and took a 52-41 lead into halftime as Campbell scored 10 points in the final 4:14. The Hornets shot 54 percent in the half to Golden State's 39 percent.

Game notes
The two coaches, Charlotte's Paul Silas and Golden State's Dave Cowens, are closely linked in pro basketball. They played together with the Boston Celtics, and coached together with the Hornets. Silas took over for Cowens in Charlotte. Silas also attended high school in Oakland. ... Hornets forward Jamal Mashburn is expected to be re-evaluated for his strained abdominal muscle in the next couple of days after receiving treatment in Vancouver this week. ... Mookie Blaylock made Golden State's first 3-pointer of the night with just over three minutes remaining to play.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.
